summary: This is an email chain from May 7, 2020, between FBI agents and US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the status of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes operational updates on her potential location and proposed surveillance methods, and notes the SDNY is close to a final charging decision.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as the target of the investigation for her complicity in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking; believed to be living in Manchester by the Sea, MA.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the central figure in the sex trafficking conspiracy for which Maxwell is being investigated.

connections.description: Maxwell is under investigation for her complicity in Epstein's sex trafficking operation.
M, as the FBI ASAC, is coordinating the investigation and surveillance efforts targeting Maxwell.

events.title: Investigation Status Update Meeting
events.description: Email correspondence to schedule a call and provide an update on the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation, including surveillance plans and charging status.

events.title: FBI Location Assessment of Maxwell
events.description: The FBI's assessment (as of January 2020) that Ghislaine Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, MA.

locations: Manchester by the Sea, MA (Boston suburb)
keyFacts: As of May 2020, the SDNY was close to a final decision on charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in Epstein's sex trafficking.
The FBI believed Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts, a fact confirmed by historical pen register data, cell site location, and Amazon delivery subpoenas.
Due to the secluded location, traditional surveillance like pole cameras was deemed unsuitable; proposed methods included a renewed pen register, Amazon subpoenas, and a potential mail cover.
The email documents a transition in FBI leadership on the case, with 'M' being named the permanent ASAC for the relevant branch.
